alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 12:53PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... St. Croix River AT Danbury affecting Pine and Burnett Counties. .Rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Croix River AT Danbury. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.4 feet on 05/02/1954. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening by 630 PM CDT.
